item.title: Report E-2025020206
item.description:
Report E-2025020206

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: CARLSTADT
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0439 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XCV. It was reported that approximately 1/2 cup of Black Base was released from a 5-gallon metal drum due to improper loading by terminal XIY. The release impacted the pallet the DM was placed on. ERTS reviewed with the caller to always call ERTS before starting any clean-up activity. Called Chemtrec and spoke to John. Report #202501500029. Product was contained in 10-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080377
item.description:
Report E-2024080377

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-15T00:55:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: Clifton
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BRENNTAG NORTHEAST, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 13250000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: BNE Driver was involved in fatal vehicle accident while traveling east bound on NJ Route 3 (Clifton, NJ), -Lat 40.8673383, Long -74.184025479. At the time of the accident the EE was driving BNE tractor #476 and loaded BNE van trailer #159. After coming in contact with a NJ Transit Bus, the vehicle went off the right side of the roadway, struck the guardrail, and went through a sound barrier wall creating a fire engulfing the tractor, spreading to the trailer, and resulted in fire and two explosions of onboard hazmat (various flammable liquids, and corrosive) freight. The EE succumbed to their injuries. Roadway was closed for several hours and Local Clifton Fire Dept was able to extinguish the fire of the vehicle, trailer and freight. First Call Environmental (ER/Environmental) contractor was able to contain, remediate, and clean-up the affected areas impacted by fire and release of hazmat at direction of EPA and NJDEP.
